views.markdown: DrainCheck adds a CC module to the control centre which upon enabling will begin monitoring battery drainage, and after you disable it, you'll get your results. You can also choose to automatically enable/disable DrainCheck with LPM / DND modes.

#### Version 3.0.8

- Added the ability to swipe on a row to individually delete a log.
- In the event that the battery data collected by DrainCheck changes in the future, DrainCheck can now automatically remove incompatible logs to circumvent crashes.
- Code changes regarding how the dates are formatted throughout the tweak/app.

#### Version 3.0.7

- Fix iPad & Landscape layout issues in the app. - Fixed the trash can icon being too small and hard to tap.

#### Version 3.0.6

UI/UX Improvements and bug fixes for the app.

#### Version 3.0.5

- Now shows the dates in the alert if the start and end date were different.

#### Version 3.0.4

- Fixes an issue where a notification from DrainCheck could come in when disabling LPM/DND mode while DrainCheck was already disabled.
- Now shows detailed information when tapping on a row inside the DrainCheck app.

#### Version 3.0.3

- Fix multiple crashes.
- UI/UX improvements.

#### Version 3.0.2

- Remove some unneeded code.
- Adjusted the credits page slightly.

#### Version 3.0.1

- Fixed an issue that prevented some people from installing DrainCheck.
- Fixed the control centre module's enabled state not updating dynamically.
- UI improvements to the app.

#### Version 3.0.0

- Rewrote the entire tweak in Swift.
- Now makes use of libgscommon for improved efficiency.
- Added DrainCheck app which stores drain log history, DrainCheck preferences and more.
- Added 2 more activator listeners (On and Off).
- Added an option to automatically enable/disable DrainCheck when DND or LPM are enabled/disabled.
- Bug fixes.
 - Now open source

#### Version 2.1.1

- Now supports Activator. You can now use activator actions to start/stop DrainCheck's battery monitoring.
